TITLE: An Uptick in Elder Poverty: A Blip, or a Sign of Things to Come?
SUMMARY: Seniors didn’t fare as well through the pandemic as most. But longer-term trends aren’t moving in their favor either.

TITLE: Finance Minister Jeremy Hunt Drops Most of U.K. Tax-Cut Plan
SUMMARY: Jeremy Hunt also put a time limit on energy subsidies, seeking to reassure markets and reduce pressure on Prime Minister Liz Truss.

TITLE: Democrats Spent $2 Trillion to Save the Economy. They Don’t Want to Talk About It.
SUMMARY: Polls show voters liked direct payments from President Biden’s 2021 economic rescue bill. But they have become fodder for Republican inflation attacks.

TITLE: The Rent Revolution Is Coming
SUMMARY: For the 44 million households who rent a home or apartment in the U.S., inflation keeps pushing costs higher and higher. Anger is rising too. It could be a breaking point.

TITLE: With So Much Riding on the Fed’s Moves, It’s Hard to Know How to Invest
SUMMARY: Where the markets go from here depends on whether and how deftly the Federal Reserve pivots from its hawkish stance.

TITLE: Apple Store in Oklahoma City Becomes Second to Unionize
SUMMARY: Workers said pay was adequate and benefits were good, but complained that managers’ practices often seemed arbitrary.

TITLE: Biden Tries to Reassure Voters on Health Care Costs Before Election
SUMMARY: At an event in Southern California, the president says his administration is working to keep costs down and warns that Republicans will drive prices higher if they gain power.

TITLE: Lessons From Liz Truss’s Handling of U.K. Inflation
SUMMARY: The sharp policy U-turn by Liz Truss, Britain’s prime minister, reveals the perils of taking the wrong path in the fight against scalding inflation.

TITLE: Biden’s ‘Made in America’ Policies Anger Key Allies
SUMMARY: The president’s plans to bolster America’s electric vehicle and battery production have opened a rift in relationships in Asia and Europe.

TITLE: Reno Is Booming. Some Workers Feel Left Behind.
SUMMARY: Companies are flocking to the Nevada city, but the rising cost of housing, gas and groceries is making daily life a struggle for many who work there.

TITLE: 2023 COLA Could Strain Social Security Program’s Solvency
SUMMARY: The Social Security Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund could be depleted a year or two earlier than expected as a result of larger payouts.

TITLE: With New Crackdown, Biden Wages Global Campaign on Chinese Technology
SUMMARY: U.S. officials pushed to choke off China’s access to critical semiconductor technology after internal debates and tough negotiations with allies.

TITLE: Inflation Was Much Hotter Than Expected, Bad News For the Fed
SUMMARY: Inflation rose quickly in September and a key measure accelerated to the fastest pace since 1982, underlining the persistence of price increases.

TITLE: Battle Over Wage Rules for Tipped Workers Is Heating Up
SUMMARY: A system counting tips toward the minimum wage is being fought in many places. Critics say it’s often abused. Defenders say workers benefit overall.

TITLE: Have You Been Shortchanged on Tipped Wages? We Want to Hear From You.
SUMMARY: Most states allow workers to be paid less than the usual minimum wage if they get tips. Experts say the system is often abused at employees’ expense.

TITLE: Labor Hoarding Could be Good News for the Economy
SUMMARY: Employers have been burned by a labor shortage. Will that make them act differently if the economy slows down?

TITLE: Amazon Labor Union, With Renewed Momentum, Faces Next Test
SUMMARY: A vote this week at a warehouse near Albany, N.Y., will help show whether the upstart union can win outside its home base on Staten Island.

TITLE: IMF Warns Rate Increases Could Spur A Global Recession
SUMMARY: The International Monetary Fund lowered its growth outlook for 2023 and suggested that interest rate increases could spur a harsh global recession.

TITLE: Biden Proposal Could Lead to Employee Status for Gig Workers
SUMMARY: A proposed rule, long awaited by labor activists, would make it harder for companies to classify workers as independent contractors.

TITLE: U.K. Government Plans an Update to Its Tax and Spending Agenda
SUMMARY: After an earlier announcement sent markets into a tailspin, the prime minister and the chancellor are under pressure to restore fiscal credibility.
